learned_patterns.description: Expo SDK version must be pinned and match across all packages — mismatches cause cryptic native build failures
learned_patterns.notes: Spent 2 hours debugging a blank screen caused by expo-router and expo-modules-core version mismatch. Always run: npx expo install --fix after adding packages.

learned_patterns.description: Use Expo Router for navigation — file-based routing is simpler and matches web patterns the team already knows
learned_patterns.notes: Evaluated React Navigation vs Expo Router. Expo Router's file-based approach reduces navigation boilerplate by ~60% for simple apps.

learned_patterns.description: Always test on both iOS Simulator and Android Emulator — platform-specific bugs are common in Expo apps
learned_patterns.notes: Shadow styles behave differently on iOS vs Android. ScrollView flex behavior differs. Test both before declaring a feature complete.

learned_patterns.description: SecureStore for sensitive data (tokens, credentials) — never AsyncStorage for security-sensitive values
learned_patterns.notes: AsyncStorage is unencrypted. JWT refresh tokens must use expo-secure-store. This is a security requirement, not a recommendation.

challenges: Expo SDK version alignment with existing web packages
Setting up shared auth state between web and mobile
solutions: Used npx expo install --fix to resolve all version conflicts
Shared JWT token management via expo-secure-store with same API contract as web
EAS Build configured with eas.json for preview and production profiles

common_mistakes.mistake: Using StyleSheet.create styles that work on web but fail on native
common_mistakes.impact: Layout broken on Android — shadows and borderRadius behave differently
common_mistakes.prevention: Test on both platforms after every visual change. Use Platform.select() for platform-specific styles.
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Have I tested this on both iOS Simulator and Android Emulator?

common_mistakes.mistake: Not setting proper flex and dimensions for list components
common_mistakes.impact: FlatList rendered outside scroll area — items cut off on smaller screens
common_mistakes.prevention: FlatList always needs explicit height or flex: 1 parent. Use Dimensions API for responsive sizing.
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Do all lists have proper flex container sizing?

preferred_approaches.approach: expo create → expo router setup → secure token storage → shared API client → basic navigation structure
preferred_approaches.reason: Standard foundation prevents common pitfalls and establishes patterns for the team
preferred_approaches.example: muaththir mobile app used this sequence — foundation was solid and easy to extend

preferred_approaches.scenario: Sharing code between web and mobile
preferred_approaches.approach: API client and business logic in shared package. UI components always separate — native UI must be native.
preferred_approaches.reason: React Native Web has limitations. Sharing UI across web and mobile causes native-feel degradation.
preferred_approaches.example: muaththir shares auth utilities but has completely separate UI layers for web and mobile

efficiency_improvements.old_approach: Manually check compatibility tables for each package
efficiency_improvements.new_approach: Run: npx expo install [packages] to auto-resolve compatible versions
